page.title: 12MADRON CHURCH.
page.content: Madron Church is the "Mother" church of Penzance.It was consecrated on the 1st.of{July 1336, }shows architectural styles of different ages and is ded- icated to St. Maddern who was a 6th. century Breton saint and missionary. It was built of granite and took 50 years for local craftsmen to complete. The seating capacity is 500 and the 14th. cent. tower has a peal of eight bells.Special features include a fine rood screen,a{Norman font,}a wagon roof with carved angels,brasses and "Nelson's Flag".This was hastily made and carried to Madron Church when the people of Penzance heard the victorious news of Trafalgar. The Baptistry is supposedly the original site of St. Maddern's church and is still used for mid-summer bap- tisms.The water from the well never runs dry and has healing properties. H
